item.title: Allison add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Allison add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The best teacher is not the one who knows most but the one who is most capable of reducing knowledge to that simple compound of the obvious and wonderful." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Allison add a quote by Henri Frederic Amiel
item.description: "To know how to suggest is the art of teaching." -- Henri Frederic Amiel

item.title: Allison add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Allison add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "[Kids] don't remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Bill Waterson
item.description: "I'm learning skills I will use for the rest of my life by doing homework...procrastinating and negotiation." -- Bill Waterson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "CALVIN: This whole Santa Claus thing just doesn't make sense. Why all the secrecy? Why all the mystery? If the guy exists why doesn't he ever show himself and prove it? And if he doesn't exist what's the meaning of all this? HOBBES: I dunno. Isn't this a religious holiday? CALVIN: Yeah, but actually, I've got the same questions about God." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Allison add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Allison add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Allison add a quote by William Morris
item.description: "Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful." -- William Morris

item.title: Allison add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot
